data.title: Nice wine list - quality food
data.text:
The outdoor tables attracted us on a warm fall late afternoon.
Wine and a couple of marvelous appetizers  and a flat bread pizza made for a great evening.

data.title: Fabulous service and Delicious food!
data.text: Went there with the hubby and had an amazing time. The two ladies at the bar were so friendly and on point. The Calamari was delicious. They had blue cheese stuffed olives for my dirty martini so I was in heaven. I was very impressed with the customer service. It is the first thing you are presented with at a restaurant and really sets the mood for the stay. The entrees were delicious.

data.title: just okay!
data.text: service is good, food is like 3 star. the only thing i disliked the most was uncomfortable sitting in the booth. the seat are way too high and in upright position. feels like a military canteen setup :(

data.title: Adequate fair
data.text: You can count on Andiamo for good Italiam food and large portions. Last night my friend and I had their 12 oz prime rib stake. The stake was tender and tasted good, but it was ordered medium rare and was server well. The sauce over the stake was very heavy and dark brown, leaving the stake unidentifiable and visually unappetizing. The mixed vegetables were a nice selection and c steamed to perfection. However they were server completely covered by the stake leaving them drowned by stake sauce. Finally, the plate presentation left much to be desired. All this for $35, excluding the wonderful Peroni.

data.title: Good value for Italian food
data.text:
We were given a gift certificate for Andiamo and decided to try Royal Oak.  We had a nice dinner, first trying the seasoned risotto rolled and filled with mozzarella and topped with pomodoro sauce.  We followed this with the Kale and Freekeh (grain) salad and then tried the tortellini filled with beef, pork and veal, and served with wild mushrooms in a mascarpone cream sauce.  

The food was good.  The bread was very good. Shared dinner, along with one bowl of soup, a scotch and two glasses of wine was reasonable at about 75.00 before tip.  We liked the videos of Italy, playing in ornate picture frames on the walls.  There was one TV showing sports near the bar for sports fans.  

Our service was average but the management of the restaurant is pleasantly conscientious in checking on the diners.  Although we enjoyed the dinner, we probably wouldn’t rush back.  We tend to favor Italian restaurants and prefer Due Venti in Clawson, Trattoria da Luigi in Royal Oak and Bella Piatti in Birmingham.  Notably all of the restaurants I mentioned might run 20.00 to 40.00 more for a nice dinner, so if price is a major consideration, Andiamo is a good option.

data.title: Service amazing, food needs improving
data.text: We decided to eat here and were welcomed by the nice gentleman, who was honestly the hostess with the mostest. Very nicely dressed and all smiles. He sat us wherever we wanted, which was at a booth by the window. The server was beautiful & friendly and so pleasant. We ordered a filet, chicken marsala, caprese tomato salad and beverages. My husbands food came out with onions on it and it didn't specify in the menu so when it came to our table, the server kindly took it back and had a new one made without onions. Then the manager came over, made sure we were satisfied, offered us a new dish & apologized, not only once, but 3 times. The food could've tasted better, but overall we enjoyed our time there. We would go back, but I'd definitely try something different like a pasta dish instead of the chicken or filet. The medium well cooked filet mignon tasted burnt and the sauce to the chicken was just bland. Veggies were a bit over done for my preference. I prefer my veggies more firm, not mushy. Overall, not too shabby of a place. Staff again, was fantastic!!!!!

data.title: Check it out!
data.text: Went here on a Saturday and the place was busy. We had a reservation so we were seated promptly. The food was good, our table ordered the Calamari Fritti and Andiamo Suppli appetizers..the Calamari was a bit bland but the dipping sauces helped with that. The French Onion soup was great, I appreciated the fact that it had a bit of cheese sprinkled on top..not a thick greasy layer of melted cheese (personal preference there). Entrees ordered at our table: Chicken Tetrazzini, Chicken Valdostana, Whitefish Siciliano and the Frutti di Mare. We all enjoyed our dishes..only complaint..pasta was a bit overcooked in all dishes. NOTE: the Frutti di Mare is served in a huge cast iron skillet..definitely enough for 2 people to share!!!! The white Sangria is great! We will be back!

data.title: Good good, bad waiter
data.text:
Solid experience food wise, I had lasagna and wife had chicken parm which were both great. I always appreciate a béchamel lasagna. However our server, Holly, was the big disappointment. There was no personality and she seemed to not care about our experience and wanted her shift to end. She took our order and delivered our food and did not return. In my opinion she does not belong at a quality diminish establishment such as this. 

I had to order my 2nd glass of wine from the busser who was absolutely outstanding. We saw him more than Holly. He kept returning to not just fill water but ensure we were having a positive experience and talk to our 16 month old daughter. He mentioned he had a 4 year old son and was a great person to talk to.

data.title: Food is always good here, but the Milla Grazie is a total joke and a scam.
data.text: I had dinner here, house salad, spaghetti with sauteed mushrooms and tomato sauce were decent.  I think this place is just average, needs to revamp their menu and step-up the culinary artistry, food tastes decent, but doesn't wow the palate, ever.

data.title: Good food, wait staff are lacking
data.text: The food was good, it is a level above Olive Garden and Carabas.  We had lasagna and the make your own pasta dish.  The wait staff and management were having some issues, couldn't tell exactly but the manager and servers were at odds with each other.  Our server got changed out halfway through.  Dinner took 2.5hrs due to the delays.  We weren't in a hurry, luckily.  If they can get their act together it is a good place, nice location, and decent food.  I'm on the fence if I truly recommend or not.  I would probably go back but not if I am presses for time.

data.title: Very good fish and pasta!
data.text: A little loud for older people when the band starts at 8 pm on a Saturday, but that's what being out on a Saturday means!  I thought the food was a little on the heavy side, especially when you order fish but the sauces were delicious.  The waiter had to press the Andiamo cards on us which was very tedious since we are not from Michigan, but he was very friendly.

data.title: Wonderful Birthday Dinner
data.text: We had the most pleasant dining experience. Attentive wait staff, excellent food and delicious desserts.

data.title: Great anniversary dinner!
data.text: We came here rather late on Saturday evening, had to be after nine, but we wanted to have a nice meal for our anniversary weekend....and boy did we!! We had a bottle of their montepulciano, which is such a delicious Italian red! My husband had the veal piccata, and I had the cedar plank salmon...talk about scrumptious! Our salads arrived the same time as our wine, and were a very nice starter; the bitterness of the arugala and the creamy dressing paired very well. After dinner I had a glass of prosecco, which was unfortunately flat, and our server promptly replaced it. The one disappointing party of the meal is how much I was looking forward to some tiramisu, and they had sold out! Everything was so great, that I know they probably have amazing tiramisu...oh well, next time!

data.title: Not sure I'll come back
data.text:
I went to Andiamo on a Friday night and was surprised with how empty it was.
We were seated promptly and our server was polite and attentive.
Food was decent, but pricey for what you get. The salads seemed big, but other dishes served at our table were relatively small.
They ambush you at the end of your meal and bring a dessert tray to the table to try to get you to buy some. They seemed pretty pushy, even though some of the diners at our table had to bring some left-overs home. We obviously didn't have room for dessert.

data.title: Loosing it's charm, leaning toward sport bar's atmosphere
data.text: We met friends here on Fri night, July 3-rd around 4:30pm. We were very disappointed to see the place go downhill. Food is still good, prices are still high, which wouldn't be a problem if the atmosphere would be the same as it was a couple of years ago. It sure changed since. Place use to have class and was perfect for a romantic dinner, special occasions or just get togethers with friends, but now it is more like one of the sports bar. Male staff are still both pleasant and professional, while some female waitresses act "desperate" as far as the attitude and appearance. Our waitress was barely dressed, very revealing top, lot's of cleavage. The service she provided was acceptable though. But for this kind of money we expect the waitresses to look and act professional and the service to be top notch.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: We have been here before & why they added TV's all over the walls of the restaurant is ridiculous. They are placed in picture frames which is cool but the TV's were so distracting. Here we are having a quiet family dinner with the Godfather & Rocky all over the walls. Come on this is not a sports bar. There are many classier Italian restaurants that have better food & cheaper drinks. Enjoyed in the past but no plans to return.

data.title: Unimpressed
data.text: Upon entering the restaurant, I noticed how busy they were, but was given the choice to sit outside, which unfortunately we did. What a mistake!!! The waitstaff could barely hear our questions about the menu, the food took an hour to come out ( between salad and entrees), and there was a complete disconnect between us and the waitstaff. I will say that this was more likely caused because of the amount of customers as well as the painfully loud sounds if the motorcycles cruising up and down the street. Regardless of the outside influences, the food was mediocre at best. Our waiter tried his best to meet our needs, but this will definitely be the last time we come here.

data.title: Good Food, Good Service, Vegetarian & GF Friendly
data.text: The food and service were very good and the chef was able to accommodate a special dietary request from one of the diners. The Risotto e Funghi was delicious but one diner found the pasta side dish that accompanied her Chicken Piccata better than the entree itself.

data.title: Wedding shower
data.text: Went to a wedding shower here on a Sunday and they had the entire restaurant closed for the party which was very nice considering how small the venue was. The food choices were chicken Caesar salad, chicken Parmesan, or gnocchi in a tomato sauce. I chose the gnocchi which was good, but cold. It came with salad and it was not very good. The dressing was maybe a creamy Italian, it was very bitter. As for the waiters they were all very friendly and we had great service. I would not come back here just because of all the other great choices in royal oak.

data.title: Great Dinner a bit expensive.
data.text:
Brought a friend to Andiamo's for her birthday.  Got a table no problem with no reservation.  The menu had great food but it's layout was scattered a bit juvenile in appearance and not very easy to follow.  Service was very friendly.  Food was excellent and very fresh for being a chain.  
The food and drinks are quite pricey here.  Two pasta entries with a few drinks and a dessert was over $100
